com.dgis.input.evdev

Class EventDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dgis.input.evdev.EventDevice

  • public class EventDevice
extends java.lang.Object
    Driver for a Linux Evdev character device. Copyright (C) 2009 Giacomo Ferrari
    Author:
    Giacomo Ferrari

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventDevice

        public EventDevice(java.lang.String device)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Create an EventDevice by connecting to the provided device filename. If the device file is accessible, open it and begin listening for events.
        Parameters:
        device - The path to the device file. Usually one of /dev/input/event*
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the device is not found, or is otherwise inaccessible.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Releases all resources held by this EventDevice. No more events will be generated. It is impossible to restart an EventDevice once this method is called.
        See Also:
        IEventDevice.close()

      • getBusID

        public short getBusID()
        Returns:
        the bus ID of the attached device.
        See Also:
        IEventDevice.getBusID()

      • getDeviceName

        public java.lang.String getDeviceName()
        Returns:
        the name of the attached device.
        See Also:

        public short getProductID()
        Returns:
        the product ID of the attached device.
        See Also:

      • getSupportedEvents

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getSupportedEvents()
        Returns:
        A mapping from device supported event types to list of supported event codes.
        See Also:
        IEventDevice.getSupportedEvents()

      • getVendorID

        public short getVendorID()
        Returns:
        the vendor ID of the attached device.
        See Also:

      • getEvdevVersion

        public int getEvdevVersion()
        Returns:
        The version of Evdev reported by the kernel.
        See Also:

      • getVersionID

        public short getVersionID()
        Returns:
        the version ID of the attached device.
        See Also:

      • getAxisParameters

        public com.dgis.input.evdev.InputAxisParameters getAxisParameters(int axis)
        Obtains the configurable parameters of an absolute axis (value, min, max, fuzz, flatspot) from the device.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis number (an event code under event type 3 (abs)).
        Returns:
        The parameters, or null if there was an error. Modifications to this object will be reflected in the device.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(InputListener list)
        Adds an event listener to this device. When an event is received from Evdev, all InputListeners registered will be notified by a call to event(). If the listener is already on the listener list, this method has no effect.
        Parameters:
        list - The listener to add. Must not be null.
        See Also:
        IEventDevice.addListener(com.dgis.input.evdev.InputListener)

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(InputListener list)
        Removes an event listener to this device. If the listener is not on the listener list, this method has no effect.
        Parameters:
        list - The listener to remove. Must not be null.
        See Also:
        IEventDevice.removeListener(com.dgis.input.evdev.InputListener)

      • getDevicePath

        public java.lang.String getDevicePath()
